thread.title: West African archipelago hit in rare hurricane strike
thread.title_full: West African archipelago hit in rare hurricane strike | News24

author: news24.com
title: West African archipelago hit in rare hurricane strike
text:
Bissau - The West African archipelago of Cape Verde was pounded by powerful winds and heavy rain on Monday in a rare hurricane strike, local officials said.
Named Fred, the storm packed winds of up to 140km per hour, according to Cape Verde's interior ministry and the US National Hurricane Centre (NHC).
Winds uprooted trees on several islands, telecommunications and electricity were affected in some regions and the national airline cancelled flights, but there were no reports of any casualties, according to emergency services on Cape Verde reached from Bissau, the capital of Guinea Bissau.
The storm "made landfall at 08:00, 35km south of Rabil", a town on the northern island of Boa Vista, said Idilton Briton, a senior official at Cape Verde's civil defence.
